page.html:
Things about me:

  • Makes web things
  • Has two indefatigable kids and a mostly understanding wife
  • Drums when he can
  • Knows a thing or two about chimpanzees
  • Has made enough schnecken to feed an entire breakfast shift
  • Has replumbed, rewired, repointed, rewalled, and otherwise restored a few old houses
  • Loves getting into nature and spying wild creatures or mushrooms
  • Lives in sunny* Portland, OR

*when it’s not raining

node.html: • MA, Cultural and Ecological Anthropology
• BA, Psychology, Phi Beta Kappa
• Coursework in Drupal CMS and Adobe CS
• Coursework in Web Development
• PhD work in Anthropology
• Board member and CMS webmaster for large neighborhood community organization promoting business development, improvement of government services, and greening and recycling programs
• Self-employed and part of green-build construction crew; framing and finish carpentry plus other GC work.
• Precinct leader during presidential campaign, registering and assisting voters, and monitoring polls during election
• Assisted in lectures and led breakout seminars in seven undergraduate anthropology courses
• Taught sections of introductory anthropology
• Gathered information through research and travel to edit and update guides to Canada and British Columbia
• Classroom aide in urban public school, helping economically disadvantaged 1st– through 3rd-graders
• Commissioned, edited, and wrote articles on subjects in Anthropology, Economics, and Business for Encarta electronic multimedia encyclopedia
• Lead assistant on studies of non-human primate behavior and cognitive development
• Designer and content writer/editor for multimedia, public educational exhibit

• Front-end engineer on small, agile team, building tools for prospective and current Medicare beneficiaries
  • React with TypeScript + SASS in a Docker container
  • Integrate with REST API built in Golang
  • Fix and improve existing code; build components, pages, and complex new features
  • Write unit, component, and integration tests with Jest-based testing libraries and Cypress
  • Leverage Medicare design system to create accessible and easily usable applications

• Front-end plus Node- and PHP-based back-end work
  • Stacks include Shopify, Wordpress/Timber, Express, MongoDB/Mongoose, RabbitMQ, Preact, Vue
  • Member of web-standards-focused team, emphasis on accessibility and performance
  • Google Analytics integrations for large e-commerce site

• Development of design system built using Pattern Lab (Webpack/Node) with Bootstrap, SASS, postCSS
  • Front-end lead on Angular application for enrolling small businesses in insurance plans
  • Front-end lead on Sitecore- and REST-API-based prescription drug search application
  • Development of reports-management and –viewing application built with AngularJS and REST API built with Spring MVC and Spring Security with JWT Auth
  • Development of responsive sites with grid-based layouts, leveraging SASS-based CSS frameworks
  • FED for JavaScript- and REST-API-driven, responsive mobile customer web portal
  • FED on electronic billing application for individual insurance subscribers and benefits administrators

• Re-architected and redesigned Human Resources intranet.
  • Performed all front-end design work, including content-driven CSS layout, with jQuery UI (progressive enhancement) and ColdFusion templating.
  • Wrote style and training guides for content migration.
  • Helped design and implement content-migration plan and process.

• In-house lead on full redesign and re-architecture of existing website on a custom CMS, hosted by Portland’s regional government, Metro
  • Planned and coordinated redesign/templating, revised IA; usability assessments; customization of CMS and WYSIWG editor, UI elements (jQuery), and 3rd-party applications (calendar, image gallery)
  • Oversaw several interns and project volunteers

skills: CSS 3+, SASS, wireframes and comps to layout
Core JavaScript, ES2015+, TypeScript, jQuery, AJAX
Development of REST and GraphQL APIs
Node and NPM scripting, package management
JavaScript testing (Jest, Cypress, Mocha, Chai, Karma)
Build and scaffolding tools (Gulp, Webpack, Rollup, Middleman)
CMS configuration and customization (Wordpress, Drupal, Sitecore, custom)
Agile development and QA process (Trello, JIRA)
Diverse OS skills – Linux, Windows, OSX, command-line

pageContext.bio: Greetings, I’m Josh. A DC native, I live in Portland, Oregon, with my wife, 2 kids, 2 cats, and a drum kit.
